intro: Galium abaujense, commonly known as the Abaujense bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are opposite, often with a hairy texture. Galium abaujense is characterized by its slender stems and is often found in temperate regions with high humidity.
